comments.body:
O título está errado

Eu tenho certeza que vocês vão amar.Mais unidades e durabilidade
ai

I woud make this into 2 different enchants; one for the elytra and falling objects damage and other one that works as a nerffed totem, the first one being for the helmet and the other one being for the chestplate to give it it's first unique enchantment and also not possible to use while using an elytra to balance it. I would also make it so it only saves you against damage that would kill you without armor (20 damage) so it doesn't protect against sword and axes but it does against maces, spears, end crystas, etc. Should give a visual hint to know when it activates too and both enchantments shouldn't let you with too much health.
There are a lot of builders in Minecraft, and the building update would sell them, and the end update would sell other players!
Es wäre ein Wirklich Hilfreiches Add-On und ich denke Viele Spieler finden diese Idee auch gut.
Nether quartz cannot be use to make armor but tools and weapons are more reasonable.
I'm suprised I didn't come up with this. +1 Vote!
Make sure to vote for yourself.

I would like to add to this. Quartz has a hardness of 7 and iron has a hardness of 4. Quartz tools and weapons should be more efficient than stone but less efficient than iron tools. Quartz tools and weapons should have a higher durability than iron tools too. Crafting however should be limited to quartz shards. It would be nice to see a better use for quartz in the nether update besides building blocks. Since we're all going to be mining for netherite we are going to have a lot of excess quartz laying around.
This is a great idea, we need more ways to fight in the neither. It is the most dangerous dimension after all.

Don't know. This would make soups kinda overpowered, as you can already just take with you both type of mushrooms (or the items to whatever soup you want) and after you eat the soups you can use them on a crafting table with the same bowls.
yes, and also stackable suspicious stew, becuase is the best food

I like this idea and think it fits well with the combat snapshots. I completely agree with you and can only come up with one possible complaint against it that it would make suspicious stews easier to tell which is which but still I don't think its that bad. Some might say that it makes suspicious stews overpowered but they say the same eith stackable potions and I disagree. I only think that they should only stack to 16 rather than 65 making them even more like potions and not overpowered
If I really wanted to, I could stack soups to IRL

I like the idea of borscht being stackable.
At least up to 16, just like bottles of honey or eggs, which have a maximum of 16.
I understand that with the suspicious stew, it is more complicated, because they can have different status effects, variable ingredients, and also the suspicious stew restores many points.
But borscht, rabbit stew, and mushroom soups, the ingredients of which don't vary, should be stackable.
Because otherwise they become completely useless as food
I like the idea.
Please I really want to have the farmer’s hat
How about it being a charactor creator item, unlockable via the time to farm achievement.
I've always wanted to wear one in Java
I approve. This is very good for storage and keeping items safe.
Shouldn't this fall under STRUCTURES?
Well made, this can be a super cool feature
Even if just tripwire hooks were given this ability, I would still be happy.
Yeah, tripwire hook would be great in this use
This could be a cool decoration in armouries for displaying swords and etcetera on a wall.
If it were just a recolored armor stand though it would make it very easy to make dynamic stationary skeletons.
Change the post to the category of parity, the category of blocks and items is incorrect
And maybe add like more colours for concrete and wool like dark blue or hot pink
Yeah, the creative inventory is a mess. They need to reorganize it for 1.14.
1.16 is out and now it just a bigger mess than before

I don’t see why it should just be rotten flesh + awkward potion.

The splash potion should make mobs stagger around.
Bilbo read it again. I says NIGHTVISION + Rottwn flesh
I said that wrong. Ignore the first comment.  What I meant to say was I think it should be rotten flesh + awkward potion.  I must have drunk a potion of nausea myself when I typed the first comment.
I think rotten flesh and an awkward potion should give you a potion of hunger.
I think I have a better idea for the main ingredient for your special potion my friend. Give me a sec...
What about a Poisonous Potato? It's much better then a full block if you know what I mean.

I feel that the best way to incorporate nausea is with the poisinos potato, because there all ready is no use for it I like the idea of it being added to night vision because it all ready affects your sight so it makes sence, but I think it makes more sence to change from a water breathing because if you eat a pufferfish it gives you nausea

I feel that the best way to incorporate nausea is with the poisinos potato, because there all ready is no use for it I like the idea of it being added to night vision because it all ready affects your sight so it makes sence, but I think it makes more sence to change from a water breathing because if you eat a pufferfish it gives you nausea
Neat idea! Adds more to mushroom islands!

So this is a rock that causes mycelium to spread? You do realize that mycelium is a part of fungal anatomy right? That being said, a way to make more mushroom biomes would be appreciated. Maybe some kind of spore you can harvest from large mushrooms or someplace within the biome.
Too op.

honestly, i have to agree with you @bilbo baggins, even though its my own idea. but it could have a use, like blocking hostile entity spawning in a 10x10 area, dont forget how rare mooshroom islands are though.
Awesome. I think that when you said that the crystal should be crafted into something to keep mobs away, I think it should be like a torch or a animal like a unicorn

i like the idea of having some creature that can follow you and block hostile mob spawning, but im not too keen on the torch since thats basically the same as a mega torch from some mod. i was thinking it could be a small floating crystal.
No. Just do a mod. Don’t want this in my world.
I never thought of that!

......why did you respond to your own idea like that?

 

Boulders in the landscape are in the game, they're just a unique feature of the mega taiga, which is a rare biome.

What would the boulders you propose be made of and where would they generate?
I think that adding boulders to the environment would be great. It would just give that little extra detail that looks pretty realistic and beautiful. They would be made out of stone and cobblestone.

I think that boulders would be great and would make its seem that every new biome you enter is entirely more unique.  as for the block that would makeup the boulder I think it could be a mix of stone and maybe a new type of mossy stone (not cobble stone just stone).
I think it should be dropped by the illusioner instead.

I think the staff should be dropped by the illusionner, but to become a Vex Summoner, perhaps it should be right clicked on a vex, because the illusionner isn't really connected to vexes, only the Evoker.
I like but i would like it more if we could atleast summon one permanent Vex. A pet of sorts.

Something like this would open up a lot of great options for combat and how a person approaches the game. Currently short of having dogs and really quickly making iron golems on the spot you can't really approach the game like you would with a pet class or summoning class. We have a lot of mobs that would be good candidates for a hypothetical pet/summoning approach to combat.

Iron Golems for tanking damage, blazes and skeletons for ranged, and shulkers for support.

Lapis is already associated with magic and enchanting in-game so maybe a system that uses lapis and special books to summon tamed entities?
I do not find the objective of this, it would make the game less challenging, therefore, less fun. In any case, play in pacific mode.
Lighting for like 1 tick per block would be cool.
Smelting Stone Bricks gives you Cracked Stone Bricks.
I like the idea but you should add that effect to dirt as well awesome idea
Working like it does for axes when you strip a log, it would be awesome.
ive been saying this!! it would be rly cool for the pick to be able to have a right click action. and cracking blocks seems perfect.

Maybe not with the pickaxe, maybe with a new tool made of copper or something

I really like this idea.

Adding to this, those cracked blocks should also have the function of disintegrating when something heavy (a mob or anvil) falls on them or moves over their top surface, as well as the player elytra crashing into their side. This would make for excellent and intuitive pitfalls.

And with that pitfall mechanic in mind, cracked glass based blocks, pried wooden planks based blocks and loose leave blocks would be created and behave the same way, allowing for more variety in pitfall materials and creating ruined looking structures.

Or instead you could have an ability to enchant water bottle into Bottle o' Enchanting and store XP this way, that would be great too!

Edit: oh that's already suggested https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360010931372-Experience-Storage-was-Fill-Bottle-o-Enchanting-
We need this because there currently no farm for wool.

As long as these cotton can be crafted into string, it sounds like a very cool idea.  Even if it’s just an alternate source of wool and a new plant to make the environment more interesting, it sounds like a good addition.

But I agree that your argument that it is needed because there is no way to farm wool is a little funny. X3. They’re called sheep and you shear them.

@ClayGoddessSari

I looked at the Minecraft Wiki and it doesn't mention how to convert wool blocks into string blocks. It would be interesting for wool blocks to be converted into string blocks. In real life wool needs to go through a mill to be converted into yarn. I think it should remain as wool blocks, and the ability to convert wool into string should be added. If you don't like my original suggestion feel free to write one that's similar to mine that includes that it should drop string instead.
You said they drop a cotton item, not wool.  Why can’t this new item also be craftable into string?

AgrarianSet5977, here's my take: you've got some potential for interesting ideas here, but what you want is not clear. I recommend that you sit down and think for a while about the relationships you want to see between cotton, spider string, string blocks, and wool blocks. Be specific. Then come back and rewrite your original post. Also, please discuss more about how your ideas would add to the game. If you do this, I will consider giving my vote, because as I said, there is good potential here.
Maybe you naturally stand atop it, but if you shift it sends you down, like scaffolding! And  then you can only jump up if there's air above so it's not a scaffolding replacement!

Yes please, even if the leaf little block is destroyed or scattered, it would be worth it.

 

Also add rakes as a tool that will let you push leaf litter around and eventually blocks.
This will be more important to keep your pets more protected.
there is a glow stick in mcee
It would help mining and so you don't waste torches
Could be strong unless the torch had durability
that would be more exiting for minecraft walking through a dark gave with a torch flicking in the dark i also came up with this idea my self
